sourcing.instructions: Cs (Cesium) can be sourced from chemical supply companies or specialized online retailers. Ge (Germanium) is available from semiconductor suppliers. La (Lanthanum) can be sourced from rare earth suppliers. Se (Selenium) is available from chemical suppliers. Ti (Titanium) can be sourced from metal supply companies.
steps: Cs (Cesium) can be sourced from chemical supply companies or specialized online retailers. Ge (Germanium) is available from semiconductor suppliers. La (Lanthanum) can be sourced from rare earth suppliers. Se (Selenium) is available from chemical suppliers. Ti (Titanium) can be sourced from metal supply companies.

1. Measure Cs, Ge, La, Se, and Ti using an analytical balance. 2. In a dry, inert atmosphere glovebox, combine Cs, Ge, La, Se, and Ti in a clean, dry ceramic mixing bowl. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powdered ingredients for 30 minutes. 4. Transfer the mixed powder to a clean crucible.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure Cs, Ge, La, Se, and Ti using an analytical balance. 2. In a dry, inert atmosphere glovebox, combine Cs, Ge, La, Se, and Ti in a clean, dry ceramic mixing bowl. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powdered ingredients for 30 minutes. 4. Transfer the mixed powder to a clean crucible.

steps: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 800 °C. 2. Place the crucible in the furnace and heat for 4 hours to facilitate solid-state reaction and ensure homogeneity of the material.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 800 °C. 2. Place the crucible in the furnace and heat for 4 hours to facilitate solid-state reaction and ensure homogeneity of the material.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Avoid opening the furnace during the cooling process to prevent contamination.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 2-3 hours). 2. Avoid opening the furnace during the cooling process to prevent contamination.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Carefully extract the solidified sample from the crucible. 3. Use sandpaper to smooth out the surfaces of the sample, ensuring dimensions fit the required 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating if necessary.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Carefully extract the solidified sample from the crucible. 3. Use sandpaper to smooth out the surfaces of the sample, ensuring dimensions fit the required 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating if necessary.
